{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50117].
  {panel}

As a admin, I would like to see a list of all team calendars, sorted by name

List:
calendar name (link to calendar view by month)
# of subscribers
# of events by type
Calendar Owner/Creator
Option to create a calendar or delete a current calendar

Ability to select which JIRA Agile Boards to use when embedding a Sprint event to selectively choose a sub-set of sprints within a project.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50112].
  {panel}

Currently, when one subscribes Google Calendar in the Team Calendars, any updates on Google Calendar will be synced/pulled to Team Calendar within one hour time. Some users reported that it takes longer than one hour. This sync interval is currently not configurable. It would be great to have this sync interval configurable somewhere.

h4. One-off Workaround
You can do either one of the following to trigger the sync:
- Flush Confluence caches by going to Confluence Admin > Cache Statistics > Flush All. To be exact, you only need to flush these 2 caches (one after another):
-- Team Calendars - Internal cache for external-sourced sub-calendars
-- Team Calendars - iCal subscription sub-calendar events
- One of our user reports that refreshing the Google Calendar page could trigger the sync as well.

h4. Better Workaround
Add the following in your {{confluence-home/config/ehcache.xml}} and then restart Confluence:
{code}
    <!-- Team Calendar Cache Config to pull GCal update to TC every 5 minutes -->
    <cache name="com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.calendarstore.ExternalCalendarDataStore" maxElementsInMemory="1000" eternal="false" timeToIdleSeconds="299" timeToLiveSeconds="299" overflowToDisk="false" />
    <cache name="com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.calendarstore.SubscriptionCalendarDataStore:subcalendar-data" maxElementsInMemory="1000" eternal="false" timeToIdleSeconds="300" timeToLiveSeconds="300" overflowToDisk="false" />
{code} 
This will get the sync to be triggered every 5 minutes. Feel free to change the duration as per your need. Please note to ensure the value of "com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.calendarstore.ExternalCalendarDataStore" is one second before the value of "com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.calendarstore.SubscriptionCalendarDataStore:subcalendar-data"
fields.summary: Make Google Calendar to Team Calendars synchronisation frequency or interval to be configurable
Provide event type that is an import of an existing ICS file
Allow Manual Entry For Dates in Date Picker

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50109].
  {panel}

Use Case:

Customer would like to register all event (Actually, it is rough plan for work rather than single day event) for each people in the team to People Calendar.

Once  events were registered, customer would want to see the events for specific person. It would be good for People Calendar to support filtering function for specific person.

As seen in: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/177388/does-people-calendar-support-filtering-function-for-specific-person

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50101].
  {panel}

We have about 300 projects, 25 date custom fields, and 500,000 issues.

When I try to add a new event, it takes six to eight seconds for the UI to finish rendering.

All the time appears to be spent in this method:
IcalendarResource.getQueryOptions()

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50098].
  {panel}

Right now, when someone adds me to the attendance list of an event, I get an e-mail with the subject:
[Confluence] John added you to the "John" calendar

It would be much more helpful to have a subject like:
[Confluence] Arno added you to the event "Friday bar" (Oct 11th, 18:00)

When creating a release or sprint, it should show project drop-down first then the name

Provide an API to retrieve calendars related to a space

fields.description:
Adding the 'JIRA Agile Sprints' event type to a calendar automatically parse the start and end dates of the selected sprint.
However, if the sprint is completed before its initial planned end date, Team Calendars continues to show the initial planned end date, which shouldn't be the case, since the sprint was already completed and shouldn't be appearing on the calendar any longer.

h4.Steps to reproduce
# Plan a sprint then start it
# Add the 'JIRA Agile Sprints' event to a calendar on Confluence
# Complete the sprint before the initial planned end date
# The sprint still appears on the calendar, even though it was completed

h3. Workaround
For incorrect sprint end dates you may be able to reopen the sprint to edit the end date:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/reopening-a-sprint-938845456.html
fields.summary: Team Calendar uses the planned end date instead of the actual end date for JIRA Agile Sprints events

fields.description:
Same issue as reported in [TEAMCAL-1219|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/TEAMCAL-1219]

Using Confluence 4.3.7 with Team Calendars 4.0.3

Created 2 usernames in LDAP, one with a capital and another all in lowercase.  When restricting editing access to the user with a capital, they still cannot edit.  Restricting editing access to the user all in lowercase, the user may edit.
fields.summary: Usernames in Team Calendar's restrictions are not case insensitive

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50066].
  {panel}

After:
- renewing our expired license key at my.atlassian.com
- upgrading Team Calendar via UPM to version 4.0.2
- configuring the new license

UPM says the new license is valid, however we get the following red notice on all pages where a calendar item is present:

“The version of Team Calendars Plugin installed (4.0.2) isn't valid for your license”.

Curiously, we also got an empty red notice as well on the calendar view (see attached screenshots).
fields.summary: "The version of Team Calendars Plugin installed (4.0.2) isn't valid for your license" alerts although UPM says license is valid

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50065].
  {panel}

If a user has a character in their profile description, the XML parser for Team Calendars will throw this error message during the nightly or manually-triggered indexing tasks:
{code}
2013-03-26 16:42:00,034 ERROR [scheduler_Worker-2] [confluence.extra.calendar3.DefaultEmbeddedSubCalendarsParser] getEmbeddedSubCalendarIds Unable to parse sub-calendars embedded in userinfo:
 admin v.3 (327681)
com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.XhtmlParsingException: The XML content could not be parsed. There is a problem at line 1, column 709. Parser message: Unexpected character ' 
' (code 32) (missing name?)
 at [row,col {unknown-source}]: [1,709]
        at com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.StaxUtils.convertToXhtmlException(StaxUtils.java:327)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.storage.StorageXhtmlTransformer.transform(StorageXhtmlTransformer.java:49)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.DefaultXhtmlContent.handleMacroDefinitions(DefaultXhtmlContent.java:213)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.osgi.hostcomponents.impl.DefaultComponentRegistrar$ContextClassLoaderSettingInvocationHandler.invoke(DefaultComponentRegistrar.java:129)
        at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy240.handleMacroDefinitions(Unknown Source)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
{code}

I used an ampersand in my testing, but other characters can cause the error as well.  When I look at the description body stored in the database, the XHTML content is *not* escaped in any way, which I think breaks the XML parser that Team Calendars is using.  This is my example userinfo:
{code}
 bodycontentid |       body       | contentid | bodytypeid 
---------------+------------------+-----------+------------
       1703938 | Hello & goodbye. |   1671170 |          0
       1703937 |                  |   1671169 |          0
{code}
fields.summary: Unable to parse sub-calendars embedded in userinfo during indexing due to unexpected character
When scrolling horizontally in timeline view events randomly adjust and jump around (hip-hop style)

fields.summary: Cannot subscribe from url

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50060].
  {panel}

When I subscribe to an iCal calendar I have on Google Calendars via private URL, it works just fine. 

I then added the same calendar, via public URL with Google's option of hiding details instead.  The calendar subscription shows up in the calendar list but none of the actual events or scheduled items show up on the calendar.

While I have this calendar on, trying to switch to alternative views like "list" just gives me the busy wheel. 

I am not sure how I did it, but I got an event to show up. It was not an event on my real calendar (was wrong time and day) and was wrong color (not the one chosen in my calendar list) but I had no other calendars and when I hide the calendar, it disappeared as well, but never came back.
fields.summary: Public Google Calendar (with details hidden) don't show up
Cannot Select groups (only users) on a calendars restrictions

fields.description:
We currently going through the mandatory red tape to renew the licencing on Confluence & Team Calendars, but I have encountered an issue on Team Calendars I need help with.

When I add a new user they don't have the "Add Event" button or the ability to click a calendar cell to add an event. Is there a licencing limitation in this respect? I suspect not as you state in your "Purchasing FAQ" we have "Perpetual Confluence Team Calendars use".

Can you confirm if this bug PLS?

Thanks
Conor
fields.summary: Team Calendars cant add event

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50055].
  {panel}

Hi Guys,
I am running into a problem where if I edit an event in confluence the edited version of the event is synced with Outlook as a completely new event and the old version of the event is left in the system.

it looks like if an event was changed or modified it creates an entirely new event and places it on the same day. If you see on the 16th of the month in the Outlook version (1.png) it has the original event and then the modified (current) event below it.

During our dev phase with "Team Calendars" it seems we didn’t have any of these issues with the plugin.

Thanks for the help,
Aaron

  {panel}

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Navigate to <base_url>/calendar/mycalendar.action
# Click Add Event
# Attempt to enter a date manually

*Expected Results:*
You should be able to manually enter a date in the format provided.

*Actual Results:*
As only numerical values are accepted, you can't comply to the provided format, and must use the calendar.

fields.summary: Getting error after upgrading Team calender plugin version
JIRA Events not shown in Team Calendar subscription
Can only print in landscape mode when using chrome.

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an application link between JIRA and Confluence
# Set up a JIRA Issue Date calendar in Confluence, and ensure it displays some events
# Delete the application link
# Go to view your Calendar page in Confluence again
#- Expected result: A small error and other calendars display
#- Actual result: The whole page is a stack trace:

# Alternatively, after a few hours the error message might change to this (due to cache flush):
{code}
Error(s) occurred.
Unable to find linked JIRA application with ID 73e5520d-9db8-32c3-bb74-482d617435d4
{code}

NB: When you delete an application link through the front end, the JIRA calendars are not updated/removed at all. You can see this by running this query in the database and observing that the old application link id persists in the value column:
{code}
select * from "AO_950DC3_TC_SUBCALS_PROPS" where key = 'applicationId';
{code}

h3. Workaround
# Recreate the application link. At this point if the application link id is the same, the calendar will display again
# If you are still seeing the error:
## *We strongly recommend performing this on a test server first to ensure the process works as expected*
## Take a [full backup of Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Production+Backup+Strategy]
## If you have the first error (NullPointerException), make a note of the calendar id in the error (eg e9b1480c-c0b0-4999-ba57-5e9b7836209c). This will be referred to as 'the-affected-calendar-id';
## If you have the second error (Unable to find linked JIRA application), make a note of the application link id. This will be referred to as 'the-*old*-application-link-id'.
## Run this query to find the new application link id:
{code}
select * from bandana where bandanakey = 'applinks.global.application.ids';
{code}
## This will yield a list of application ids wrapped in <string> tags. If there is only one, make a note of it. This will be referred to as 'the-*new*-application-link-id'.
##- If you have more than one, to figure out which is the correct one, run this query with each application link one at a time:
{code}
select * from bandana where bandanakey like '%the-application-link-id-from-the-above-query%';
{code}
Look through the results of each of these and check the URLs to determine which is the new application link to the JIRA server. This will be referred to as 'the-*new*-application-link-id'.
## If you experienced the first error (NullPointerException) and do not current have 'the-*old*-application-link-id', run this to find it, otherwise skip to the next step.
##- Run this to find 'the-*old*-application-link-id: {code}
select "VALUE" from "AO_950DC3_TC_SUBCALS_PROPS" where calendar_id LIKE '%the-affected-calendar-id%';
{code}
##- Grab this value. This will be referred to as 'the-*old*-application-link-id'.
## Run this to determine if there are any other calendars that reference 'the-*old*-application-link-id':
{code}
select * from "AO_950DC3_TC_SUBCALS_PROPS" where "VALUE" LIKE '%the-*old*-application-link-id%';
{code}
## Make a note of the IDs of any rows returned
## Update the JIRA calendars:
{code}
update "AO_950DC3_TC_SUBCALS_PROPS" set "VALUE" = 'the-*new*-application-link-id' where "VALUE" LIKE '%the-*old*-application-link-id%';
{code}
# Restart Confluence

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50033].
  {panel}

The root cause of this issue is the parent of internal subscriptions are stored InternalSubscription bandana data context instead of Parent bandana data context.

Solution:
- create new CalendarBandanaProvider to handle ParentInternalSubsciption 
- modify InternalSubscriptionCalendarBandanaProvider to handler child subscription only

fields.description:
Using the US date time format (AM/PM) configuration on Team Calendars, when editing an existing Calendar Event, as soon as the edit form is opened the “start" and the “end” time automatically show as 24h instead of 12h format.

*Steps to reproduce:* 
1. Create an event in the calendar. 
2. Write anything on the “What” field.
3. Uncheck the “All day event” checkbox. 
4. Select a date time to start and to end on the “When” field. 
5. Save it.
 6. Edit the event you’ve just created. 
7. See that “start” and the “end” time changed to 24h format.  

*Example: *
Create an event:
	▪	What: Test
	▪	When: May 28, 2014 8:00 PM to 9:00 PM May 28, 2014
	▪	Repeat: Does not repeat
	▪	Click on "OK" button. 
!create_event.png|thumbnail!
	▪	Event successfully created.
!event_created.png|thumbnail!
	▪	Click on the event and select "Edit".
	▪	The edit form will open showing the time in 24h format instead of 12h format.
!edit_event.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Team Calendars does not respect time settings when editing events

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50026].
  {panel}

Hello Atlassian,

I am not sure if this is the right way to address a support request to you or if I should go with the Confluence support, I hope I am not messing it up too much.

I experience some unreasonable behavior of team calendars. In the last month, I cleaned up our old calenders and adapted the new concept of having one team calendar per team. In the calendar view (top bar in confluence, next to the create button), I am getting all current calendars, and all deleted ones are gone. Unfotunately, when I use the calendar macro and "add an exisiting" calendar or go to the settings and add calendars in the list, I am still seeing some calendars that should have been deleted. I tried to show this in the attached screenshots. The deleted calendars are marked yellow and as you can see, they do not show up in the calendar view. Only in the macro search.

Is this a bug?

Cheers,
Chris

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50024].
  {panel}

Hi,
Just to take you back a problem we faced.
Following an update plugin Team Calendar and having met the bug TEAMCAL-1742, we uninstalled the plugin and reinstalled a previous release. Since we do not receive the email notification when creating events. (even after updating the plugin with new versions)
After some research and testing we have found a solution to restore normal operation. We must remove all calendars of sight ("Remove this calendar from my calendar view") then re-add these calendars. After this, we get the new email notification in the creation of events.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50022].
  {panel}

Hello,

we are currently introducing Confluence in a 5000+ company and would have many use cases for also introducing and licensing the Team Calendar. 

But I am confronted with some curious problems by using our default browser IE (9.0.8112.16421) and IE 8. There is currently no browser alternative planned.

I think it's a performance and/or compatibility problem. I identified the following symptoms:

# If I embed the TC macro into a page, there is usually a flyout to edit or delete appointments. If I click on a appointment to display this flyout, the browser goes very slow and nothing happens. The javascript error in the browser console is in graphic 01 snapped.
# Also regarding the TC macro. If I try to configure the macro in the edit-mode of a page, the button often does not react and never on the first click. The javascript error is snappend in graphic 02.
# The general performance of confluence is greatly reduced on pages where the TC is embedded or if the user is in the actual TC overview. It is not possible to open the dropdown menu's (regarding TC), they disappear directly after clicking on them.
# In *IE 8*, page scrolls slowly when you add an *Event* to a Calender. 



Maybe you have an idea or fix for our problem. We would really like to implement the TC plugin into our upcoming confluence environment.
fields.summary: Performance Problems and Visualization Bugs in IE9 and IE8

fields.description:
h3. Summary of bug

Under certain conditions, in the List View of Team Calendars, the last day of  the event is not shown.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create an event in Team Calendars that fulfills the following conditions :
#* The event has a start and end time
#* The event lasts more than one day
#* Start time on 1st day is "after" end time of last day. i.e.: Event starts at 2pm and ends at 9am.

The result would be the following :

!Calendars.png|thumbnail!

As shown in the screenshot (both the left and right sides are referring to the same event), in the list view, the last day of the event (24th of May) is not shown.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50016].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:

 * Start up a Confluence (any recent version will do) instance with the JVM arg "-Duser.timezone=America/Santiago".
 * Install TC 4.2.4
 * Create a calendar.
 * Create a couple of daily recurring events that go on indefinitely.
 * Observe how events now take a while to load on the page. For me, even just a couple of recurring events was taking 5+ seconds to render the events.json payload.
 * Stop the Confluence instance, start it back up without the America/Santiago timezone.
 * Observe how events.json is now sub-100ms average response time.

I added some profiling calls and found that [lines 672 and 673 of DefaultCalendarManager.java|https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/CONF/repos/teamcal/browse/team-calendars/src/main/java/com/atlassian/confluence/extra/calendar3/DefaultCalendarManager.java?at=refs%2Ftags%2Fteam-calendars-project-4.2.4#672] were taking 1.5 seconds each (3 seconds in total for those two lines to execute). These get called in a loop for all recurring instances of an event.

Some observations (may not be useful):
 * Breakpoint on net.fortuna.ical4j.model.TimeZoneRegistryImpl.getTimeZone reveals that timezones.get("America/Santiago") returns null. Seems strange.
 * [~merickson] mentioned that there is some code somewhere in ical4j that will actually try and resolve timezone data from an external resource if it can't figure it out locally, or something. I didn't actually stumble on this code though.
fields.summary: Team Calendars freaks out when using the America/Santiago timezone

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50009].
  {panel}

A shared calendar that contains JIRA Issue events from both public and private filters will not show any events _at all_ for users if one of the private filters is restricted from them. 

h3.Steps to Reproduce

* Create a new calendar and add JIRA Issue events from a filter shared with everyone
* Add JIRA Issue events from a filter that is restricted to the creator
* Add the calendar to a shared page
* Navigate to the page as a user who is restricted from the private filter. The calendar will be empty (screenshot: calendar_userview.png). The expected behavior is that the calendar would at least show the events from the public filter. Users who have permission to view the events from all filters will see all the events (screenshot: calendar_adminview.png)

fields.summary: Calendar with public and private filters shows no events

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50006].
  {panel}

when using the team calender macro inside a table cell then the *calender does not scale correctly* if:
* timeline view is selected
* and legend is off

If legend is on then scaling is correct. 

Sidenote: 
Without legend the macro seems to produce a small version with minimal width of the calendar view. This can be observed when the calendar without legend is the only content in the table column, in that case the table does not use 100% width of the page but remains rather small.
nasty effects occur when several calendars are embedded in separate rows but the same column of the table and only one of those has a legend. In this case the table is scaled to full width, all calendars are scaled to full width, but the content of those calenders without legend is not scaled.
One click on +/- corrects the problem.

!nasty-effects.JPG|width=100%!
fields.summary: team calender macro does not scale correctly inside tables
No spinner on dashboard while loading upcoming events.
Missing translation string for team calendars cache key index cache
Cursor position jumps from JQL field to title field when creating new JIRA calendar
Duplicate Events in Calendar
Server 500 on My Calendars View
Team Calendars notifications popping into table of contents
Adding a recurring events is throwing NullPointerExceptons when generating notification
Regression: Team Calendar no longer displays field name giving its date
Calendar Creators do not receive Watch Notifications

{code}

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Upload the attached [^example.ics] file to a web server
# In Team Calendars, click Add Calendar > Add New Calendar > Subscribe by URL
# Put in an arbitrary name for the calendar, and in the URL field, point to the URL of example.ics
# Click Subscribe, and the error will be shown

In the example file above, the timezone is set to "Coordinated Universal Time":
{code}
X-WR-TIMEZONE:Coordinated Universal Time
{code}

h4. Other considerations
It's worth noting that if the same .ics file were to be downloaded first, and the "Import Calendar" option is used to upload this .ics to Team Calendars, the problem does not occur. In this case, Team Calendars will display a user-friendly message: "There is no valid time zone information in the uploaded iCalendar file" (see screenshot: [^import_calendar.png]).
fields.summary: When subscribing by URL to a calendar with an unrecognized timezone, a stacktrace appears on screen
Drag and drop Jira issue does not move.
Add Event button overlapping with Month Year

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49968].
  {panel}

We like to show the Entries from "What" and "Who" Field in the Month or Week View. If Description is filled this Entry should be shown instead of "What".

Currently the Behavior is:
1) Add an Event with What and Who:
Only What is shown.
2) Add an Event with What, Who and Description:
Who and Descpriton is shown.
3) Add an Event with What and multiple Who:
Multiple Who is shown.
fields.summary: Show "What" and "Who"

To replicate issue:
1) Panel into confluence page
2) Set background different that white or none
3) Insert team calendar into this panel
4) Change type of calendar into List
5) Ensure that there will be some records in viewed period.

You will see that events have unexpected white frames and day have white background. See screenshot - Second case.

I would exact no frame and transparent background.
fields.summary: Team Calendars layout background colour for list view isn't transparent

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49958].
  {panel}

When printing in Confluence via Google Chrome, the default page orientation is set to Landscape. However, the options to override this default in Chrome print preview is disabled. 

h4.Steps to Reproduce

# Install Team Calendars 4.1.x version (in my case 4.1.3)
# Open a Confluence page in Google Chrome (version 31.0.1650.63)
# The Print orientation option should be displayed like this: 
!print.png!
# However, the result is the following with Team Calendars installed:
!printc.png!

Note that it doesn't happen with Team Calendars 4.0.x versions.
fields.summary: No Print Page Orientation in Google Chrome if Team Calendars 4.1.x is Installed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49957].
  {panel}

*Steps*
* Suppose that you have a birthday event
* Edit the event
* Uncheck the "Edit instance only"
* Change the event type, example travel event
* Check the "Edit instance only again". After this type, user will think that he can change the event type of THIS event only


*Actual*
* Actual result: It change all the event in the event series

*Expected*
* User think he can change type for ONE event only
fields.summary: User can misunderstand that they can change event type of ONLY 1 event in the series of event

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-49953].
  {panel}

When creating a JIRA calendar in Confluence, the saved filter option fails.  If we choose saved filter, the below options for values to display is not populated and the calendar cannot be saved (see attached screen shots)

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a full trust link between Confluence and Jira
# From the dashboard click 'My Calendars' -> 'Add Calendar' -> 'Add New Calendar' -> 'Jira Calendar'
# Give the calendar a name
# Click 'Saved Filter' and choose a known filter in Jira
# Notice that lower area fails to populate with field options and the calendar cannot be saved

*Workaround*
After choosing a filter, click the 'JQL (advanced)' option and then click back to 'Saved filter'.  The options area will then populate and the calendar will be able to be created and saved.
fields.summary: Create Calendar by JIRA Saved Filter Fails
